name: Prince Conti Hotel

reviews.text: We stayed in room 340 at the Prince Conti 9/14-9/18/06 and had a wonderful experience. The charming room was lovely and clean, with it's own coffeemaker and an ironing board (wish there were a few more hangers). The cleaning staff were prompt and helpful, and when Lisa left her rosary in the room when we returned to Nashville, Betty (on your cleaning staff) found and turned in the rosary, which was mailed immediately to her(Thank you Eva). This kind of honesty and service is hard to find these days, and whenever we visit New Orleans, we will stay at the Prince Conti and have already recommended it to several friends. Many thanks to all of the staff who provide such and enjoyable, safe place to stay in New Orleans!
reviews.title: Prince Conti excels

likes.liked: — graciousness of our hosts, honesty and service

reviews.text: stayed at the prince conti over the labor day weekend. first room offered (third floor) had badly damaged drywall from water/moisture. and a very heavy mold smell. second room (second floor) nicer furniture but just as offensive to the nose. third room (also 2nd floor) had leak damage to the cieling from its a/c system. but a lesser mold smell. i took it . thed bag was getting heavy.
reviews.title: eehh! three strikes

reviews.text: the previous guest had left the comment card .check out my pictures.
reviews.title: Great Location! Nice rooms!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the room had damage to the wall paper .as did all the furniture. the wingback chair had the fabric of each arm rest in shreds. two or three window panes had cracks across them and scotch tape place over the cracks.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: my buds stayed at the monteleone and raved about it.
reviews.title: Great deal in a great city recovering from Katrina

likes.disliked: — Hallways were a bit small and dark - room was nice - no real views to speak of

reviews.text: If you want a hotel right off Bourbon Street, then this one is in an excellent location. Several locals were concerned I wouldn't get any sleep due to noise from Bourbon Street, but I never heard a sound (of course I was on the third floor on the side away from Bourbon Street). Bed was comfortable, bathroom was small but functional, nice decor (however edges on veneer of several pieces of furniture was chipped), clean, and no musty odors. Staff was friendly and helpful- it was the staff which raised my rating from average to above average.
reviews.title: Slightly above average

likes.disliked: — Great location and hotel if you plan to spend a lot of time on Bourbon Street

reviews.text: I spent May 10th to May 16th at your hotel. I just wasnt to say how nice and professional everyone was. The 3 women that worked the front desk were just SUPER. Also, the housekeepers were very nice. The manager was always asking if there was anything he could do to improve my stay. Everything was wonderful. I will return.
reviews.title: Everything was Wonderful

reviews.text: Thanks to everyone.
reviews.title: Couldn't wait to leave

reviews.text: My boyfriend and I had to stay at the Prince Conti earlier than expected because the power went out at the bed and breakfast we were staying at. We had booked a suite for Thursday night and we were lucky enough to get it for Tuesday and wednesday night, too. Wed. and Tues. night rates were higher though, which was odd. The front desk clerk was nice on the phone but extremely snotty and condescending to me in person. I needed him to put the new room charges on a different credit card and when the bill he handed me didn't make it clear that a different card had been used he got very huffy. We went to our room and although it was large, the carpet was filthy and our feet turned black from walking around. The bathroom sink was clogged and I was told that they didn't have a plunger to fix it. Someone had stolen it. They said that someone would come by after noon to fix the sink (as we are late sleepers) and was rudely awakened before 8am by the guy wanting to fix the sink. We were not dressed and still sleeping so we told him to come back. He never did. Also, one of the valets was quite rude to me. We came in to park at 6pm and he asked if we needed to use the car for the rest of the night. When I told him I wasn't sure (it was pretty early to make plans for the rest of the night) he demanded that I make up my mind. I repeated that I didn't know, and he said he needed to know so he could go park our car down the road to make room for other cars. I told him he'd better leave it there and he got pretty [---]. I do not enjoy being talked down to by valets. I don't pay money to stay somewhere only to be treated like a second-class citizen. The room was shabby and there was no "private courtyard" as advertised on the website. I'm sticking to at least four-star from now on. I advise everyone else do the same.
reviews.title: Excellent, Clean & Quiet
Fine Room, Great Service, Excellent Location
reviews.text: The Prince Conti was a beautiful and clean hotel. It was less than a minute walk to all the noisy fun of Bourbon St. but just far enough to not be disturbed by it. The staff was friendly and helpful. We parked the car with the valet and I left my purse in the car accidently for a night and nothing was touched! I went with my boyfriend but would often leave his side to walk back to the hotel to use the restroom since it was so close then I would meet back with him and I felt safe everytime I left. We did not have a chance to eat at the restaurant but it look very clean and nice, while we were there they were offering a 2 for 1 breakfast speacial.
I have read some of the negative views, and they make me wonder if we are talking about the same Prince Conti hotel.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay

likes.liked: — big room, good price, great location, efficient staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My check in was smooth and friendly. My room was very roomy, clean and quiet, with attractive and comfortable furniture. The shower and the water pressure were very good.
reviews.title: Disgusting, loud and bathroom full of bugs

likes.liked: — Location is the only thing going for this hotel
likes.disliked: — Terribly loud, bugs and just bad, bad, bad

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is super -- just a block from Bourbon Street and yet far enough away so that it is not noisy.
reviews.title: Great Value and Location

likes.disliked: — Had to use elevator for i floor; mildly creaky celing above us

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My checkout was fast and easy, and the valet delivered my car to me within minutes.
reviews.title: The Perfect French Quarter Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was a DISASTER. I booked this hotel after reading positive reviews on Tripadvisor and because of the terrific location in the French Quarter. We looked at different rooms within the hotel before choosing one with actual windows. The rooms located in the interior of the hotel, have no windows and many of the rooms on the perimeter of the hotel face brick walls. We finally settled in room 334 which had windows looking over Conti Street (pronounced Con-Tie).
reviews.title: Simply Outstanding

likes.liked: — The room was huge and beautiful

reviews.title: Prince Conti Hotel
reviews.text: The Conti has a very small and nice but unpretentious lobby. The hallways gave no hint of what we would find in our room, actually a suite with a small kitchen (which we didn't use.) It was quite well furnished, with antique or reproduction furniture. It had its own little garden off the separate sitting area, a completely unexpected treat. This room also offered a substantial library of books a few of which, if we weren't in the French Quarter and otherwise occupied, I would have loved to read. In some rooms close to Bourbon St. I'm told you can occasionally hear the revelers; but ours was utterly quiet at all hours. The bed, though high, was quite comfortable. Two restaurants are on site; we patronized one for a good breakfast.

reviews.title: Graduation via Conti
reviews.text: The French Quarter missed the worst of Katrina, though many staff at many businesses suffered great personal loss. With all that New Orleans has gone through, it would be foolish (and unkind) to demand perfection at any hotel or restaurant, but we found little complain about even by pre-Katrina standards, and much to love.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wonderful place in N.O. Staff are all helpful, from opening doors to getting an extra boxof kleenex. Rooms are always clean and well taken care of. Ask anyone on staff, and you can get ditections torestaurants or a taxi to any destation. This was our second stay at the Conti and it will not be our last. Planning to stay there for Thanksgiving of 2007.
reviews.title: Pince of a hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this hotel online based on previous reviews but mostly for the price and location.
reviews.title: What a Rare Gem!

reviews.text: The location is just 1/2 block off Bourbon street (close enough for the many trips to the bathroom during a night out on Bourbon) but quiet enough to seem a world away.
reviews.title: Awesome Service
Prince Conti very nice
reviews.text: The price was outstanding especially for the New Year's weekend with the Saints playing in town and the Super Bowl this week.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff at the front desk and the cleaning service was quite friendly and check in was a breeze. However, they did manage to sell us on a $4.95/day telecommunications deal that I don't think was necessary. It was to include high speed internet and unlimited incoming and outgoing phone calls w/ voicemail. We have cellphones so our reason for taking it was for the internet. The internet was an unsecured wireless set up which means that we could have used it without paying the additional $5/day. I probably would have complained but the room price was so reasonable, I didn't feel like I was being robbed.
reviews.title: get star treatment at the Prince Conti hotel

likes.liked: — well kept and clean, friendly helpful staff

reviews.text: My friends and my finace stayed at this hotel the weekend before Valentine's day. I thought the hotel was charming. Our room was an interior room with a big comfy King-sized bed. Our friends had a room facing Conti Street which was a little noisy on Saturday night - but hey - this is New Orleans. Upon arrival, the front desk clerk wasn't all the friendly, but the Valet and bell hop were. The maids did a great job cleaning and all our basic needs were taken care of. I have been to New Orleans many times as it is my favorite city anywhere and have stayed in numerous hotels. The Prince Conti has an old-world charm and great location - if you are looking for your average big hotel - stay on Canal Street - not in the Quarter. Even post-Katrina New Orleans still charms - the people were friendly and the food as incredible as always. We were able to eat at almost all favorite places - Antoines; NOLAs; Petunias; Gumbo Shop; and tried the wonderful Cafe Adelaides in the Loew's Hotel - go for the 25 cent martinis and their gumbo was fabulous. These restaurants are all in walking distance from the Prince Conti Only downside was Commander's Palace had not yet opened. I would recommend this hotel as good inexpensive hotel in a great location.
reviews.title: Don't Agree With Previous Two Posts

reviews.text: My fiancee and I stayed at the Prince Conti for a couple of nights and were EXTREMELY disappointed. It just goes to show you that a nice-looking website does not truly depict the quality of a hotel.
reviews.title: Very disappointing!!

reviews.text: I had expected to stay in a place that was clean and charming. Instead, we were in a room in which the lampshade had caught on fire and melted at some point in time, there was a HUGE hair on the mirror and the place hadn't been painted in years.
reviews.title: Nothing to crow about

reviews.text: We did not find the staff to be very friendly, but then again, we didn't come across many friendly New Orleans residents the entire weekend.
reviews.title: Great Location, Wonderful Hotel
One word: Average
reviews.text: If you are planning on spending some time there, be sure to bring your own water. There is only 1 vending machine in the hotel and it is filled with soda--only one "slot" for water and it ran out on Saturday. I was told by the staff to go to a convenience store to get water--there was nothing they could do to help.

Every single employee, from the concierge to the parking attendant to the maid staff, was friendly, courteous, helpful and did everything they could to make our stay enjoyable. Our room was lovely and comfortable. In room wi-fi service was steady and dependable. And the location is really quite convenient - especially if you plan to spend the majority of your time in the French Quarter.
reviews.title: Great Service
Prince Conti Hotel
reviews.text: Just returned from New Orleans this morning, 6/18/06. We stayed 6 nights at the Price Conti and would not hesitate to do it again. The only drawback, which is also a good point depending on your needs, is the proximity to Bourbon Street. The revelers returning to their rooms in the early morning hours were a bit of an annoyance. The hotel was very clean and the staff were all very helpful and friendly. Room was cleaned and linens were changed daily. We parked our prize Mustang convertible with the valet and they cared for it like it was their baby also. The Hotel is within comfortable walking distance of the entire French Quarter. Hubby could walk to Cafe Du Monde and back in the time it took me to shower (This was a BIG PLUS for him!)

reviews.title: Great service and location!
reviews.text: I got a great rate for Sun-Tues 4/23-4/25/06 so I could attend the French Quarter Fest on Sun and celebrate my birthday on Mon. My room was an interior one and very quiet--the room was immaculate and service was great! The manager(John) and the front desk attendant(Velda) were very personable and very helpful. I arrived early in the morning (8am) and the desk clerk that day(didn't catch her name) found me a room that was ready, which I hadn't expected. I would definitely return here. The mattress on my king bed was excellent--got a great night's sleep both nights. After many hours of walking both days, it was definitely appreciated. The location is wonderful--just a half block from Bourbon. I highly recommend this hotel!

We wanted to stay in the French Quarter and picked the Prince Conti for its location. We were in no way disappointed. Be warned, it overlooks Conti and Bourbon Streets, and it can be very noisy outside at night. I hear they have "inside" rooms, but we didn't know that. However, if it's a French Quarter location and a French Quarter type hotel you want, the Prince Conti is superb. We walked everywhere. The Prince Conti is not a chain hotel, so don't expect large impersonal rooms. The rooms were clean and comfortable, and the one little problem (broken light switch) was fixed immediately. The real bonus was the staff. Amy at the desk knows EVERYTHING about New Orleans, and she and Peter (also at the desk) set up tours and events for us; they and other hotel employees also made restaurant suggestions which were fantastic. We had a memorable meal every night. When we had a problem with our airport pickup, Amy got right on the phone herself and got someone there for us at once so we didn't miss our flight. I would certainly recommend visiting New orleans (they need the tourism) and staying at this hotel.
reviews.title: Prince Conti staff helped make trip memorable
Overall very good However.............
reviews.text: After thoroughly reviewing this hotel via their website and Tripadvisor.com as well, I decided to give it a try. I am a frequent traveler to the French Quarter and I do know my way around. My experience with the reservations agent was fine, was impressed with the check-in process and the valet staff who assisted me with my truck. The room was clean and my wish for a room over-looking Conti was honored. I was awoken at approximately 3am by the noise coming from Bourbon Street, but hey, it is NOLA after all. My only concern is that this hotel still uses the age-old

description: Intimate French Quarter Hotel housed in building dating from the early 1900s.
